turns.speaker: MARTIA
turns.text: That's not his knee.  Not everybody keeps their genitals in the same place, Captain.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Anything else you want to tell me?

turns.speaker: MARTIA
turns.text: When whoever it is makes their move, you won't be here to ask if he's the one.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: There's gotta be a way out of this place...

turns.speaker: MARTIA
turns.text: Listen. No one has ever escaped from Rura Penthe.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Except us.

turns.speaker: MARTIA
turns.text: It IS possible.

turns.speaker: MARTIA
turns.text: I know how to get outside the shield.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Where do we come in?

turns.speaker: MARTIA
turns.text: Getting outside the shield is easy. After that it's up to you to get us off the surface before we freeze. Can you?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Possibly.

turns.speaker: MARTIA
turns.text: I can't make it alone. You're the likeliest candidate to come to this god-forsaken place in months.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Candidate for what?

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: Maybe if their particles just got a wee bit mixed...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Energize...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Stand down your weapons.

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: Captain, if --

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Stand DOWN, Mr. Scott. All stop. That's an order.

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: Aye, sir.

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: This is incredible -

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: WHO ELSE...?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: As you were. Lieutenant...?

turns.speaker: LT. SAAVIK
turns.text: Saavik, sir. We were told you'd need a helmsman -  ... so I volunteered.

turns.speaker: LT. SAAVIK
turns.text: Aft thrusters -

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Thank you. Lieutenant, one quarter impulse power...

turns.speaker: LT. SAAVIK
turns.text: Captain, may I remind you that regulations specify thrusters only while in space dock?

turns.speaker: LT. SAAVIK
turns.text: Aye, sir.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Plot a course for Kronos, Lieutenant.

turns.speaker: LT. SAAVIK
turns.text: Kronos, sir?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: I'm still in the chair, Lieutenant.

turns.speaker: LT. SAAVIK
turns.text: Aye, sir.

turns.speaker: LT. SAAVIK
turns.text: Sorry -

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Come on, Saavik, you COULD knock -

turns.speaker: LT. SAAVIK
turns.text: We're almost at the rendezvous - I thought you'd want to know...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Right -

turns.speaker: LT. SAAVIK
turns.text: I gather you are not enthusiastic about the assignment... I don't think many on board are.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: You piloted well out of spacedock, Lieutenant -

turns.speaker: LT. SAAVIK
turns.text: I always wanted to try that.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Only don't try putting words in my mouth.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Uhura, hailing frequencies. Right standard rudder, bring us alongside...

turns.speaker: LT. SAAVIK
turns.text: Right standard rudder, Z plus five degrees...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: I hope you're happy.

turns.speaker: LT. SAAVIK
turns.text: Captain.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Saavik, you know anything about a neutron energy surge?

turns.speaker: LT. SAAVIK
turns.text: Sir?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Mr. Chekov, anything unusual?

turns.speaker: LT. SAAVIK
turns.text: Captain, our shields -- !

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Uhura, signal our surrender.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Who is "US?"

turns.speaker: LT. SAAVIK
turns.text: I won't allow Starfleet to be dismantled over some Klingon promises.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Starfleet will be around long enough for me to convene a Court Martial on this ship, Lieutenant. Win, lose or draw it will be on your record.

turns.speaker: LT. SAAVIK
turns.text: Just the prototype.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: You hear that?

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: This is Captain Sulu, USS Excelsior.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Sulu!

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: Standing by, Captain Kirk.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: You understand that by even talking to us, you're violating regulations, Captain.

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: I'm sorry, Captain - your message is breaking up.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Bless you, Sulu.  Where's the peace conference? They're going to attempt another assassination.

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: The Conference is at Camp Khitomer, near the Romulan border. I'm sending the exact coordinates on a coded frequency.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: I'm afraid we may need more than that. There's a Bird of Prey on the lookout for us. And she can fire while she's cloaked.

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: Surely not.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: I'm telling you. Hang on.  How many of those things are there? Come on, Lieutenant, you're charged with murder...

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: I'm getting underway now. But you should know, I'm in alpha Quadrant. The chances of my reaching the conference in time are slim.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: When does this conference start?

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: According to my information, today.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Thank you, Captain Sulu.

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: Don't mention it, Captain Kirk.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Me?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: We have volunteered to rendezvous with the Klingon ship that's bringing Chancellor Gorkon here, and escort him safely through Federation space.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: I have personally vouched for you in this matter, Captain.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: You have personally -

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: WE volunteered?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: There's an old Vulcan proverb: only Nixon could go to China.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: How could you vouch for me? That's...  ... arrogant presumption -

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: I was asked by my father to open neg-

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: I know your father's the Vulcan Ambassador for heaven's sake, but you know how I feel about this: they're animals.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Jim, there is an historic opportunity here -

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: DON'T TRUST THEM. DON'T BELIEVE THEM -

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: They're dying.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: LET THEM DIE.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Lieutenant, I am pleased to see you.  The Lieutenant is the first Vulcan to be graduated at the top of her class as the Academy.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Congratulations, Lieutenant. That must make you very proud...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Never been this close.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: The Chancellor is undoubtedly awaiting our signal.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: I believe the Captain feels that Starfleet's mission has always been one of peace -

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Far be it for me to dispute my first officer. Starfleet has always -

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: I don't believe our own conduct will distinguish us in the annals of diplomacy...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: I'm going to sleep it off. Let me know if there's some other way we can screw up tonight.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: I am uncertain.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Spock, I'm really tired...

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: We are reading an enormous amount of neutron radiation.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Where?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Curiously it appears to emanate from us.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: From Enterprise?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: What the -

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: We've fired on the Chancellor's ship -

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: We HAVEN'T fired -

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: According to the data bank, we HAVE - twice...

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: I am responsible for involving you in this. I will go.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: I'M going. You are going to be responsible for getting me out of this. Meantime we're not going to be the instigators of a full-scale war on the eve of universal peace.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Perhaps you're right.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Captain...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: He was just about to explain the whole damn -

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: The Klingons have a new weapon: a Bird of Prey that can fire while cloaked. She torpedoed Gorkon's ship.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: So, that's it..

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: The peace conference.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: What peace conference?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Azetbur has agreed to meet the Federation at a undisclosed location to continue her father's work... the conspirators obviously intend to try again...

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: I've been dead before. Uhura, raise Excelsior. She ought to have the co-ordinates.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Why would they give them to us?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: The Commander is an old friend of yours.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Are you dining on worms?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: You were right: it was arrogant presumption that got us into this situation. You might have died.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: The night is young. Anyway, it was logical.  You know, you're a great one for logic. I'm a great one for  rushing in where angels fear to tread. We're both extremists. Reality is probably somewhere in between us.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: I was blind. I couldn't see past the death of my son. I couldn't trust.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: I too was blind. I knew about HER - and I did nothing. I trusted too much.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: You couldn't have known she was listening the night I dictated that entry into my log. You were proud of her achievements as a Vulcan.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: I was PREJUDUCED by those achievements.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Gorkon had to die before I understood how prejudiced I was...

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Can we two have grown so old and inflexible that we have outlived our usefulness?  Would that constitute a joke?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Someone said the difference between comic and cosmic is the letter "S." You haven't outlived your usefulness - to me. And you are not responsible just because she is also Vulcan -

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: I SHOULD have been -

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Not for the actions of another. No one is responsible for any actions but his own. Human beings -

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: But I am not human. I am only -

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Spock, you want to know something?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Close enough to beam down?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Not yet... Section 4236...

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Captain, perhaps we're going about this the wrong way; our job is to get to the conference; HER job will be to stop us.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Make ourselves a target?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: What's she waiting for?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Probably trying to figure out why we're reversing, wondering if we detect her.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: But we haven't run out of history just yet.  Your father quoted Hamlet: he called the future - "the undiscovered country"...

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: I always assumed Hamlet meant death.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Gorkon thought the undiscovered country might mean something else - another kin of life. People can be very frightened of change. I know I was.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: The only way to find out if a man's trustworthy...

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: ... is to trust him.

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: Control tower, reading, Sir.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Control, this is Enterprise requesting permission to depart.

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: Channel open, Captain.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: This is the Starship Enterprise, Captain James Kirk commanding.

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: Captain --

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: WE SURRENDER.

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: This is Enterprise. We surrender. Repeat  Enterprise surrenders --

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: It's pretty chaotic over there. There's been some weapons fire and a lot of shouting...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: I'm going aboard. Spock, you have the conn.

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: Gorkon's own man??

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Who else?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Uhura?

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: Nothing, Captain. If they're here, they're rigger for silent running.

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: Captain, we can't see her, but she gives off heat...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Not from a distance. She won't show up on ANY type of scan.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: You have done well, Saavik. As your sponsor at the Academy I have followed your career with... satisfaction. And as a Vulcan.

turns.speaker: LT. SAAVIK
turns.text: Sir, I speak to you as a kindred intellect. Do you not recognize that a turning point has been reached in the affairs of the Federation?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: I am not certain such speculations are included among your duties, Lieutenant.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: You must have faith.

turns.speaker: LT. SAAVIK
turns.text: Faith...?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: That the universe will unfold as it should.

turns.speaker: LT. SAAVIK
turns.text: But we can't allow them to be taken back to Kronos as prisoners.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: What do you suggest, Lieutenant? Opening fire won't retrieve the Captain; and an armed engagement was precisely what he wished to avoid.

turns.speaker: LT. SAAVIK
turns.text: How did you - ?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: In the meantime we must endeavor to piece together what happened here tonight. According to our data banks, this ship fired those torpedoes.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Her own father...?

turns.speaker: LT. SAAVIK
turns.text: Such things have happened before, sir.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Any reply from Starfleet to our dispatch, Lieutenant.

turns.speaker: LT. SAAVIK
turns.text: Not as yet, sir.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Curious. You haven't been assisting Commander Uhura with her radio transmissions, have you, Lt?

turns.speaker: LT. SAAVIK
turns.text: Commander Uhura has been experiencing technical difficulties sir.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Very well. For twenty-four hours we'll agree that this conversation did not take place.

turns.speaker: LT. SAAVIK
turns.text: A lie?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: An omission. After that -

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Any progress?

turns.speaker: LT. SAAVIK
turns.text: We've got a crew of three hundred turning their own quarters inside out,  but the killers may be among them. Surely they've disposed of these boots by now. Wouldn't it have been logical to leave them on Gorkon's ship?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Even logic must give way to physics. Gravity hadn't been restored by the time they escaped. Without their boots they would not have stayed on the Klingon transporter pads.

turns.speaker: LT. SAAVIK
turns.text: Suppose when they returned they threw the boots into the garbage?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: I'm having the garbage searched. If my surmise is correct these boots will cling to the killers' necks like Tiberian bats. They couldn't make their escape without them; nor can they simply throw them out a window for all to see; no - they're here. Somewhere.

turns.speaker: LT. SAAVIK
turns.text: A lie?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: An error.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: If you are logical.

turns.speaker: LT. SAAVIK
turns.text: I don't want to.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: I believe you. Please...

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: But it was when you tried to persuade me the Captain was guilty that I should have understood.

turns.speaker: LT. SAAVIK
turns.text: You can't prove any of this...

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Perhaps neither of us was hearing very well that night, Lieutenant. There were things I tried to tell you too - about having faith.

turns.speaker: LT. SAAVIK
turns.text: You've betrayed the Federation - all of you.

turns.speaker: LT. SAAVIK
turns.text: Direct hit -

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: Confirmed, Captain!

turns.speaker: LT. SAAVIK
turns.text: Trouble?

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: We've been ordered to -

turns.speaker: LT. SAAVIK
turns.text: In nineteenth century France, workers who felt their livelihood threatened by machines, flung their wooden shoes - called SABOTS - into the gears to stop them. Hence the word SABOTAGE.

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: We are experiencing a technical malfunction. All backup systems inoperative.

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: We can send a message to Starfleet Command -

turns.speaker: LT. SAAVIK
turns.text: I do not think so. Enterprise has disobeyed orders and harbors two escaped convicts. Admiral Donald will make certain all your ship-to- shore transmissions are jammed.

turns.speaker: OFFICER
turns.text: Sorry to wake you, sir, but Starfleet urgently requests any data we may have on the whereabouts of Enterprise.

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: OFFICER
turns.text: Apparently they're refusing to acknowledge signal to return to spacedock, sir.

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: Signal Starfleet that... we have no idea location of Enterprise.

turns.speaker: OFFICER
turns.text: Sir?

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: You having hearing problems, mister?

turns.speaker: OFFICER
turns.text: No, sir.

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: According to this we've completed our exploration of the entire sector.

turns.speaker: SCIENCE OFFICER
turns.text: Fifty-four planets - and their gaseous atmospheric anomalies. Our sensing and analytic equipment worked well.

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: Then it's time we were heading home. Three years is...

turns.speaker: SCIENCE OFFICER
turns.text: I have an energy wave from 240 degrees mark six port --

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: Visual!

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: Don't tell me that was any meteor shower.

turns.speaker: SCIENCE OFFICER
turns.text: Negative. The subspace shockwave originated at bearing three-two- three, mark seven-five, the location is...  Praxis. A Klingon moon. Barren of indigenous life forms but -

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: Essential as a resource. Praxis is their key energy production facility.  Send to Klingon High Command: "This is Excelsior, a Federation Starship traveling through Beta Quadrant. We have monitored a large explosion in your sector. Do <u>you require assistance</u>?"

turns.speaker: SCIENCE OFFICER
turns.text: I have confirmed the location, sir, but...

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: SCIENCE OFFICER
turns.text: ... I cannot confirm the existence of Praxis.

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: Praxis?

turns.speaker: SCIENCE OFFICER
turns.text: What's left of it.

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: At least we must keep track of where they are taken, sir. I -

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: I've already addressed that question, Mr. Scott. We'll e able to follow the Captain's movements.

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: NO WAY!

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Mr. Scott, you forget yourself. Please accompany me.

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: It's as I said, Mr. Spock: Inventory still registers every torpedo.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Yet the data banks insist we fired: twice. One computer is lying.

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: A computer canna lie, sir.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: I think  not.

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: You can check the torpedoes visually, if you like -

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: We'll have to check every one of them, Mr. Scott.

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: That could take hours!

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Nevertheless.

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: And if they're still in place?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Then someone forged a data bank entry.

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: They don't place the same value on life that we do, Spock - you know that... take my word: she didn't shed one bloody tear...

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: That's hardly conclusive, Mr. Scott, as Klingons have no tear ducts.

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: Twenty-four hours from now we won't have a clue where the Captain is.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: I know precisely where he'll be.

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: They dinna fire on themselves. And there were no other ships present.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: There was an enormous neutron energy surge.

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: Not from us!

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Too far off. Very near us. Perhaps... underneath us...

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: If another ship had been beneath us the Klingons would've seen her!

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Would they?

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: A Bird of Prey canna fire when she's cloaked!

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: This one can.

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: They you're talking about a dreadful new engine of destruction, Mr. Spock.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: I believe I am.

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: - could take weeks, sir.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Thank you, Mr. Scott. We were to return to spacedock, the killers would surely manage to dispose of their incriminating footwear.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: They're outside the beaming shield. Mr. Scott, start your engines.

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: Aye, aye, sir.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: They're naturally wary, ma'am. We've been at war a long time.

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: How do both sides overcome ingrained prejudice?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: I assume command of this ship as of  0130 hours. Uhura, send to Starfleet HQ. Explain precisely what has taken place, and request instructions.

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: Yes, sir.

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: Sulu's giving us his position and telling us he's standing by...

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: He's placing himself in a most awkward position...

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: An ancestor of mine maintained that if you eliminate the impossible whatever remains - however improbable - must be the truth.

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: What exactly does that mean?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: It means that if we cannot have fired those torpedoes then someone else did.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: And they'd be right. We have no evidence - just a theory that happens to fit the facts...

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: Even assuming you're correct, Mr. Spock, why would they fire on their own President?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: I want this ship searched from bow to stern. Lieutenant Saavik, you are in charge. Start with the transporter room and work your way outwards...

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: I've pulled out my - uh wooden shoe and Starfleet is screaming for us to return to port.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Mr. Scott, any progress on repairing our warp drive?

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: You understand that we have lost all contact with Captain Kirk...?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: At present, he's surrounded by a magnetic shield. If my calculations are correct, he should be deep into his escape planning by this time.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: I don't think Starfleet could have envisioned our current predicament.

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: Maybe we should write them a letter?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Under impulse power she expends fuel like any other ship. We call it "Plasma" - I do not know the Klingon name for it, but by any name it is merely ionized gas.

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: Well, what about all that atmospheric equipment we're carrying to catalogue gaseous anomalies?

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: They might as well arrest me, too; I felt like Lieutenant Saavik.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: But you didn't join a conspiracy.

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: Can you tell me how you came to be on the planet where we found you?

turns.speaker: B-9
turns.text: I was taken from my homeworld by people called the "PakJeds." They are fat. They traded me to a ship belonging to the "Bolians." The "Bolians" are blue. They put me in a seat and asked me questions. Then they were attacked by another ship...

turns.speaker: B-9
turns.text: Fuzzy face is gone.

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: Yes, please continue.

turns.speaker: B-9
turns.text: I was in space for a long time. Then a ship belonging to the Talosians" picked me up. They asked me where I came from. I told them people called the Pakleds" took me from my homeworld. They are fat

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: Do you know who I am?

turns.speaker: B-9
turns.text: You are me.

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: No. My name is Data... I am your brother.

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: Do you know where you are?

turns.speaker: B-9
turns.text: I am in a room with lights.

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: Can you remember our father?

turns.speaker: B-9
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: Do you know the name of the Captain of this vessel?

turns.speaker: B-9
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: Is that your final answer?

turns.speaker: B-9
turns.text: Brother. I cannot move.

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: No, I have only activated your cognitive and communication subroutines.

turns.speaker: B-9
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: Because you are dangerous.

turns.speaker: B-9
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: You have been programmed to gather information that can be used against this ship.

turns.speaker: B-9
turns.text: I do not understand.

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: Do you know anything about Shinzon's plans against the Federation?

turns.speaker: B-9
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: Do you have any knowledge of the tactical abi1ities of this ship?

turns.speaker: B-9
turns.text: No. Can I move now?

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: No. I must deactivate you.

turns.speaker: B-9
turns.text: For how long?

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: Indefinitely.

turns.speaker: B-9
turns.text: How long is that?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: I notice Dr. Crusher laughing along with the rest of you. As most of you know, the doctor will also soon be leaving the Enterprise, to assume command of Starfleet Medical. Again, I'm forced to ask, Beverly, have you considered what you're doing to little ole me?! I'll probably get some old battle-axe of a doctor who'll tell me to eat my vegetables and put me on report if I dont show up for my physical on time!

turns.speaker: BEVERLY
turns.text: It'll serve you right.
